optimization_record.recommendation_description: This Signal Integrity (SI) advisor gives you information about how to use Quartus II to improve the Signal Integrity for your design including the Simultaneous Switching Noise (SSN).
The following recommendations are general recommendations for any design. Double-click a category to view the recommendations for that category.
The following recommendations are provided for reducing Simultaneous Switching I/O Noise. Double-click on a category to get the specific recommendations for that category.

optimization_record.recommendation: How to use the SI Advisor
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Implement the recommendations in the SI Advisor to improve the Signal Integrity of your design.
optimization_record.description: The SI Advisor provides a set of recommendations for improving the Signal Integrity of your design.

action.action_description: Use the recommendations provided by the SI Advisor to make project or individual settings and assignments, or make design changes to improve the Signal Integrity of your design.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: You can use the Support section of the Altera web site or Quartus II Help to obtain more information on the specific recommendations and Quartus II settings and assignments in the SI Advisor.
optimization_record.description: You can find many of the recommendations in the SI Advisor in the Signal Integrity Center on the www.altera.com. You can also get help on the specific settings and assignments described in the SI Advisor by using Quartus II Help.

action.action_description: For more information, use the Design Optimization for Altera Devices chapter of the Quartus II Handbook or Quartus II Help.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Create a revision before making the recommended project and individual settings and assignments and design changes.
optimization_record.description: You can create a revision before implementing the recommendations in the SI Advisor, and then compare the revisions after performing a compilation to view the results.

action.action_description: Create a revision using the Revisions dialog box (Project Menu), make the recommended changes, perform a compilation, and then view the results of the compilation using the Compare Revisions dialog box (Project menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Turn on smart compilation to minimize compilation time.
optimization_record.description: During a recompilation after a smart compilation, the Compiler determines which Compiler modules are required to process the current design based on the changes made to the design since the smart compilation, and then skips any modules that are not required. Refer to Use Smart Compilation in Quartus II Help using the link below.

action.action_description: Turn on Use smart compilation in the Compilation Process page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Use lower drive strength values on the output and bidirectional pins.
optimization_record.description: One of the most effective methods of reducing SSN is directly reducing the amount of current utilized in the SSO pins by reducing the I/O drive strength settings for the involved output pins. . In practical design, system speed requirements constrain how low current drive strength can go. Timing margins on the fast-switching data interfaces may prevent the use of low current drive strengths. Whenever possible, however, do not use more I/O drive strength than is required. SI and timing simulation should be performed to determine the maximum necessary drive strength of the I/O.

effect_list.fmax_effect: - Tsu slack, Tco slack and Fmax may decrease
effect_list.resource_effect: - Ground Bounce and VCC Sag will decrease

action.action_description: Select the lower drive strength values for the outputs and bidirectional pins with extra timing margin using the Assignment Editor's I/O Features panel. Use the button provided below to review current drive-strength selection for all output and bi-directional pins in your design.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Lower the number of SSO pins to be below Altera recommended limits.
optimization_record.description: By limiting the number of SSO pins, ground bounce and Vcc sag can also be minimized. The SSN dependence on number of SSO is a non-linear function showing saturation with increasing number of SSO. One option is to spread out SSO through the package to utilize additional return paths, decreasing the average return current in the loop.

effect_list.resource_effect: - Ground Bounce and VCC Sag will decrease

action.action_description: For all output and bi-directional pins in your design select location assignments such that the number of SSO in an I/O bank is kept below the Altera recommended limits. Use the button provided below to review the Altera recommended SSO limits per I/O bank for the current device.
